instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15‚Äù Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..
definitions.GPUVCORE_EN: What is GPUVCORE_EN? GPUVCORE_EN enables GPU VCORE when it is high, a power rail necessary for the GPU to function so you can get an image on the screen. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .
definitions.PPVCORE_GPU: What is PPVCORE_GPU? This is the main power rail for the GPU. This is required for the GPU to turn on so you can get image on the display. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no picture
threads.message:
hi, i just got that board 

no video

so i tested the lcd with a working board. that is ok.

i resoldered the <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> but still nothing

L8960 and L8930, L8310 and L8360 have no power at all

the machin is chiming

no <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0GPU</SIGNAL>

in Diode mode there is almost the same value like on the good board (<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0GPU</SIGNAL> rail)

missing <SIGNAL>GPUVCORE_EN</SIGNAL>

so where to look now? 

gmux problem ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no picture
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no picture
threads.message: I'm a noob, but I believe it's not possible to have image without <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0GPU</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_GPU</SIGNAL> neither on external nor internal screen, or is it? Do you have <SIGNAL>P3V3GPU_EN</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no picture
threads.message: Replace <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> and inspect for knocked off parts in the area.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no picture
threads.message:
i dont had the chance to try that, customer was coming and toke the device back. a pity.
thanks for suggestions.
